item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Jesse Jackson
item.description: "There is nothing more painful to me at this stage in my life than to walk down the street and hear footsteps... then turn around and see somebody white and feel relieved." -- Jesse Jackson

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: ". . . for when women are the advisers, the lords of creation don't take the advice till they have persuaded themselves that it is just what they intended to do. Then they act upon it, and, if it succeeds, they give the weaker vessel half the credit of it. If it fails, they generously give her the whole." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Tut, tut, child!" said the Duchess. "Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "Despair has its own calms." -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Aeschylus
item.description: "A great ox stands on my tongue." -- Aeschylus

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She tried to fancy what the flame of a candle is like after the candle is blown out, for she could not remember ever having seen such a thing." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Geoffrey Chaucer
item.description: "Purity in body and heart May please some--as for me, I make no boast. For, as you know, no master of a household Has all of his utensils made of gold; Some are wood, and yet they are of use." -- Geoffrey Chaucer

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Geoffrey Chaucer
item.description: "Then you compared a woman's love to Hell, To barren land where water will not dwell, And you compared it to a quenchless fire, The more it burns the more is its desire To burn up everything that burnt can be. You say that just as worms destroy a tree A wife destroys her husband and contrives, As husbands know, the ruin of their lives. " -- Geoffrey Chaucer

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Americans, while occasionally willing to be serfs, have always been obstinate about being peasantry." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All thinking men are atheists." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He who controls the past controls the future. He who controls the present controls the past." -- George Orwell

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps a lunatic was simply a minority of one." -- George Orwell

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "Death is the veil which those who live call life; They sleep, and it is lifted." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "As happens sometimes, a moment settled and hovered and remained for much more than a moment. And sound stopped and movement stopped for much, much more than a moment." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I accept Time absolutely. It alone is without flaw, It alone rounds and completes all, That mystic baffling wonder." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Ignorance is like a delicate exotic fruit; touch it and the bloom is gone." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have always been of opinion that a man who desires to get married should know either everything or nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All art is at once surface and symbol. Those who go beneath the surface do so at their peril." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The basis of optimism is sheer terror." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alessandra add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare
